column2: 3. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:

column2: 4. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: in school zones.
column8: on multiple lane highways.

column2: 5. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 6. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column6: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.
column8: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.

column2: 7. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column6: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column8: when your lane is empty.

column2: 8. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column6: narrower and shorter
column8: larger and deeper

column2: 15. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?

column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
